text: ਗੂਜਰੀ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਜੈਦੇਵ ਜੀਉ ਕਾ ਪਦਾ ਘਰੁ ੪
section: Gujari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Goojaree, Padas Of Jai Dayv Jee, Fourth House:

transliteration.text: gūjarī srī jaidēv jīu kā padā ghar 4

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

section: Gujari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਪਰਮਾਦਿ ਪੁਰਖਮਨੋਪਿਮੰ ਸਤਿ ਆਦਿ ਭਾਵ ਰਤੰ ॥
section: Gujari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: In the very beginning, was the Primal Lord, unrivalled, the Lover of Truth and other virtues.

transliteration.text: paramād purakhamanōpiman sat ād bhāv ratan .

melody.description: If there is a perfect simile for Raag Gujari, it would be that of a person isolated in the desert, who has their hands cupped, holding water. However, it is only when the water begins to slowly seep through their joined hands that the person comes to realise the real value and importance of the water. Similarly Raag Gujari leads the listener to realise and become aware of passing time and in this way comes to value the precious nature of time itself. The revelation brings the listener to an awareness and admission of their own death and mortality, making them utilise their remaining ‘life time’ more wisely.

author.author: Saint Jaidev
author.description:
Saint Jaidev [circa 1200], also known as Jayadeva, whose two hymns are found in the Guru Granth Sahib is a celebrated Sanskrit poet who also wrote the Gita Govinda which describes the relationship between Krishna, Radha and the Gopis of Vrindavana. His father was Bhoidev, a Brahmin, and his mother Bamdevi.

Saint Jaidev was born in Kenduli Sasan village, in the Prachi valley, Khurda district in Orissa, India. He became the most famous of the five distinguished poets, known as the five jewels, that lived in the court of Lakshman Sen, King of Bengal, who erected a monument in their honour.

text: ਪਰਮਦਭੁਤੰ ਪਰਕ੍ਰਿਤਿ ਪਰੰ ਜਦਿਚਿੰਤਿ ਸਰਬ ਗਤੰ ॥੧॥
section: Gujari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: He is absolutely wonderful, transcending creation; remembering Him, all are emancipated. ||1||

transliteration.text: paramadabhutan parakrit paran jadichint sarab gatan .1.

melody.description: If there is a perfect simile for Raag Gujari, it would be that of a person isolated in the desert, who has their hands cupped, holding water. However, it is only when the water begins to slowly seep through their joined hands that the person comes to realise the real value and importance of the water. Similarly Raag Gujari leads the listener to realise and become aware of passing time and in this way comes to value the precious nature of time itself. The revelation brings the listener to an awareness and admission of their own death and mortality, making them utilise their remaining ‘life time’ more wisely.

section: Gujari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Dwell only upon the beauteous Name of the Lord,

section: Gujari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: the embodiment of ambrosial nectar and reality.

text: ਨ ਦਨੋਤਿ ਜਸਮਰਣੇਨ ਜਨਮ ਜਰਾਧਿ ਮਰਣ ਭਇਅੰ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Gujari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Remembering Him in meditation, the fear of birth, old age and death will not trouble you. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: n danōt jasamaranēn janam jarādh maran bhaian .1. rahāu .

melody.description: If there is a perfect simile for Raag Gujari, it would be that of a person isolated in the desert, who has their hands cupped, holding water. However, it is only when the water begins to slowly seep through their joined hands that the person comes to realise the real value and importance of the water. Similarly Raag Gujari leads the listener to realise and become aware of passing time and in this way comes to value the precious nature of time itself. The revelation brings the listener to an awareness and admission of their own death and mortality, making them utilise their remaining ‘life time’ more wisely.

text: ਇਛਸਿ ਜਮਾਦਿ ਪਰਾਭਯੰ ਜਸੁ ਸ੍ਵਸਤਿ ਸੁਕ੍ਰਿਤ ਕ੍ਰਿਤੰ ॥
section: Gujari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: If you desire to escape the fear of the Messenger of Death, then praise the Lord joyfully, and do good deeds.

transliteration.text: ishas jamād parābhayan jas svasat sukrit kritan .

melody.description: If there is a perfect simile for Raag Gujari, it would be that of a person isolated in the desert, who has their hands cupped, holding water. However, it is only when the water begins to slowly seep through their joined hands that the person comes to realise the real value and importance of the water. text: ਭਵ ਭੂਤ ਭਾਵ ਸਮਬ੍ਯਿਅੰ ਪਰਮੰ ਪ੍ਰਸੰਨਮਿਦੰ ॥੨॥
section: Gujari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: In the past, present and future, He is always the same; He is the embodiment of supreme bliss. ||2||

transliteration.text: bhav bhūt bhāv samabyian paraman prasannamidan .2.

melody.description: If there is a perfect simile for Raag Gujari, it would be that of a person isolated in the desert, who has their hands cupped, holding water. However, it is only when the water begins to slowly seep through their joined hands that the person comes to realise the real value and importance of the water. text: ਲੋਭਾਦਿ ਦ੍ਰਿਸਟਿ ਪਰ ਗ੍ਰਿਹੰ ਜਦਿਬਿਧਿ ਆਚਰਣੰ ॥
section: Gujari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: If you seek the path of good conduct, forsake greed, and do not look upon other men's property and women.

transliteration.text: lōbhād drisat par grihan jadibidh ācharanan .

melody.description: If there is a perfect simile for Raag Gujari, it would be that of a person isolated in the desert, who has their hands cupped, holding water. However, it is only when the water begins to slowly seep through their joined hands that the person comes to realise the real value and importance of the water. text: ਤਜਿ ਸਕਲ ਦੁਹਕ੍ਰਿਤ ਦੁਰਮਤੀ ਭਜੁ ਚਕ੍ਰਧਰ ਸਰਣੰ ॥੩॥
section: Gujari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Renounce all evil actions and evil inclinations, and hurry to the Sanctuary of the Lord. ||3||

transliteration.text: taj sakal duhakrit duramatī bhaj chakradhar saranan .3.

melody.description: If there is a perfect simile for Raag Gujari, it would be that of a person isolated in the desert, who has their hands cupped, holding water. text: ਹਰਿ ਭਗਤ ਨਿਜ ਨਿਹਕੇਵਲਾ ਰਿਦ ਕਰਮਣਾ ਬਚਸਾ ॥
section: Gujari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Worship the immaculate Lord, in thought, word and deed.

transliteration.text: har bhagat nij nihakēvalā rid karamanā bachasā .

melody.description: If there is a perfect simile for Raag Gujari, it would be that of a person isolated in the desert, who has their hands cupped, holding water. However, it is only when the water begins to slowly seep through their joined hands that the person comes to realise the real value and importance of the water. text: ਜੋਗੇਨ ਕਿੰ ਜਗੇਨ ਕਿੰ ਦਾਨੇਨ ਕਿੰ ਤਪਸਾ ॥੪॥
section: Gujari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: What is the good of practicing Yoga, giving feasts and charity, and practicing penance? ||4||

transliteration.text: jōgēn kin jagēn kin dānēn kin tapasā .4.

melody.description: If there is a perfect simile for Raag Gujari, it would be that of a person isolated in the desert, who has their hands cupped, holding water. However, it is only when the water begins to slowly seep through their joined hands that the person comes to realise the real value and importance of the water. text: ਗੋਬਿੰਦ ਗੋਬਿੰਦੇਤਿ ਜਪਿ ਨਰ ਸਕਲ ਸਿਧਿ ਪਦੰ ॥
section: Gujari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Meditate on the Lord of the Universe, the Lord of the Universe, O man; He is the source of all the spiritual powers of the Siddhas.

transliteration.text: gōbind gōbindēt jap nar sakal sidh padan .

melody.description: If there is a perfect simile for Raag Gujari, it would be that of a person isolated in the desert, who has their hands cupped, holding water. However, it is only when the water begins to slowly seep through their joined hands that the person comes to realise the real value and importance of the water. The revelation brings the listener to an awareness and admission of their own death and mortality, making them utilise their remaining ‘life time’ more wisely.

text: ਜੈਦੇਵ ਆਇਉ ਤਸ ਸਫੁਟੰ ਭਵ ਭੂਤ ਸਰਬ ਗਤੰ ॥੫॥੧॥
section: Gujari - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Jai Dayv has openly come to Him; He is the salvation of all, in the past, present and future. ||5||1||

transliteration.text: jaidēv āiu tas saphutan bhav bhūt sarab gatan .5.1.

melody.description: If there is a perfect simile for Raag Gujari, it would be that of a person isolated in the desert, who has their hands cupped, holding water. However, it is only when the water begins to slowly seep through their joined hands that the person comes to realise the real value and importance of the water.
